comment.author: 9912988@N02
comment._content:
Interesting that there's a mosque within an ancient temple...any reason why it was built within the ruins of the ancient polytheistic religion? I wonder if it was built there to show one religion taking over another, ancient Egyptian to Muslim... (Of course by the time this was built, the Egyptian faith was long gone, but the temple was still clearly visible!) I also wonder if there was a Coptic church built inside this temple, as a means of converting the people of the time? 

I get the impression that different religions build in the same place. Not just in Luxor but all over the world. Maybe it's more resourceful than building from scratch on a brand new site? Or maybe it shows superiority of one religion over another? (This isn't a critique of religion overall, just a historically minded observation...I find this interesting.)
